net.dean.jraw.http

Class RestClient<T extends RestResponse>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.RestClient<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpClient<T>, NetworkAccessible<T,RestClient<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RedditClient

    public abstract class RestClient<T extends RestResponse>
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpClient<T>, NetworkAccessible<T,RestClient<T>>
    This class provides a high-level API to send REST-oriented HTTP requests with.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestClient

        public RestClient(java.lang.String defaultHost,
          java.lang.String userAgent,
          int requestsPerMinute)
        Instantiates a new RestClient
        Parameters:
        defaultHost - The host on which to operate
        userAgent - The User-Agent header which will be sent with all requests
        requestsPerMinute - The amount of HTTP requests that can be sent in one minute. A value greater than 0 will enable rate limit enforcing, one less than or equal to 0 will disable it.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultHost

        public java.lang.String getDefaultHost()
        Gets the host that will be used by default when creating new RestRequest.Builders.
        Returns:
        The default host

      • isHttpsDefault

        public boolean isHttpsDefault()
        Checks to see if RequestBuilders returned from request() will be executed with HTTPS. Note that this can be changed per request later.
        Returns:
        If HTTPS will be used by default

      • setHttpsDefault

        public void setHttpsDefault(boolean useHttpsDefault)
        Sets whether or not RequestBuilders returned from request() will be executed with HTTPS. Note that this can be changed per request later
        Parameters:
        useHttpsDefault - If HTTPS will be used by default

      • setTimeoutLength

        Sets the time in milliseconds the HTTP client will wait before timing out
        Parameters:

      • getTimeoutLength

        public long getTimeoutLength()
        Gets the length in milliseconds the internal HTTP client will wait before timing out
        Returns:
        Timeout length in milliseconds

      • setEnforceRatelimit

        public void setEnforceRatelimit(int requestsPerMinute)
        Whether to automatically manage the execution of HTTP requests based on time (enabled by default). If there has been more than a certain amount of requests in the last minute (30 for normal API, 60 for OAuth), this class will wait to execute the next request in order to minimize the chance of Reddit IP banning this client or simply returning a 403 Forbidden.
        Parameters:
        requestsPerMinute - The amount of HTTP requests that can be sent in one minute. A value greater than 0 will enable rate limit enforcing, one less than or equal to 0 will disable it.

      • isEnforcingRatelimit

        public boolean isEnforcingRatelimit()
        Checks if the rate limit is being enforced. If true, then thread that execute(RestRequest) is called on will block until enough time has passed
        Returns:
        If the rate limit is being enforced.

      • executeWithBasicAuth

        public T executeWithBasicAuth(RestRequest request,
                     java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
                                            throws NetworkException
        Description copied from interface: HttpClient
        Executes an HTTP request with basic authentication. See RFC 2617 for more information.
        Specified by:
        executeWithBasicAuth in interface HttpClient<T extends RestResponse>
        Parameters:
        request - The request to send
        username - The username to use. Will be encoded into base 64
        password - The password to use. Will be encoded into base 64
        Returns:
        A RestResponse from the resulting request
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful

      • isSavingResponseHistory

        public boolean isSavingResponseHistory()
        Notifies the client to log every response received. You can access this data by using getHistory(). This defaults to false.
        Returns:
        Checks if this client is saving response history

      • setSaveResponseHistory

        public void setSaveResponseHistory(boolean saveResponseHistory)
        Notifies the client to log every response received. You can access this data by using getHistory().
        Parameters:
        saveResponseHistory - Whether or not to save the HTTP responses received

      • isLoggingRequests

        public boolean isLoggingRequests()
        Checks if this RestClient is logging HTTP requests using SLF4J. The full URL, form data, and time spent sleeping are displayed also (unless it has been marked as sensitive). Enabled by default.
        Returns:
        If requests are being logged
        See Also:
        RestRequest.getSensitiveArgs()

      • setRequestLoggingEnabled

        public void setRequestLoggingEnabled(boolean requestLogging)
        Sets whether or not to log HTTP requests. The full URL, form data, and time spent sleeping are displayed also. Enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        requestLogging - Whether or not to log requests
        See Also:
        RestRequest.getSensitiveArgs()

      • getHistory

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<T,java.util.Date> getHistory()
        Gets a map of responses to LocalDateTimes, in which the LocalDateTime refers to the time that the response was received. Will be empty unless changed using setSaveResponseHistory(boolean).
        Returns:
        The response history

      • getHttpLogger

        public HttpLogger getHttpLogger()
        Gets the HttpLogger that will log the HTTP requests and responses that this class sends and receives.
        Returns:
        This RestClient's HttpLogger
